oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Smoky Mountain Serenade - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Smoky Mountain Serenade radio program, part 1 of 3, produced by WSM in conjunction with the BBC. Personnel include George D. Hay (announcer), Jud Collins (announcer), Louie Buck (announcer), Bradley Kincaid (performer), Mac McGar (performer), Roy Acuff (performer), Eddy Arnold (performer), Uncle Dave Macon (performer), and Jack Stapp (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bradley Kincaid
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (George D. Hay) -- Theme (Old Joe Clark) -- Opening statement (Jud Collins) -- Jud Collins introduces Louie Buck -- Louie Buck introduces Bradley Kincaid -- Bradley Kincaid talks about the origins and growth of folk music in America -- Foggy, Foggy Dew (Bradley Kincaid) -- Bradley Kincaid introduces his next song -- Barney McCoy (Bradley Kincaid)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: BBC Radio; WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Smoky mountain serenade (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Collins, Jud; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Kincaid, Bradley; Acuff, Roy; Arnold, Eddy, 1918-2008; Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Stapp, Jack, 1912-1980
